pros: Small class size, friendly co-worker, can easily provide help to students

review_title: Stay away, even if it means living off the system!
pros: Schedule flexibility and working with students. At this point there is still a degree of academic freedom in the classroom and some students who are interested in their education.
cons:
There is no leadership, accountability or reward for hard work or performance. The organization does not value its employees and expects more and more work for free. The President is creating a climate of fear instead of collaborative teamwork. There have been no increases for inflation for at least 10 years let alone raises for performance or education and rank. Employees of Bethany College have lost a minimum of 25% buying power of the past years and it is probably closer to 40%. Cost of living has not been maintained let alone merit or additional raises. Salary is arbitrary and there is no traditional metrics that rewards education and rank as is customary in higher education. There are also NO opportunities to increase income based on additional workload. That is just expected. Morale is low and athletics are the life of this educational institution when academics and faculty should be the heart and soul! 

The College is allowing anyone in the door that has a pulse. There are way to many students who are not prepared to be at College and will not be successful regardless of additional resources made available to them.

1) The salary in Bethany college is so low that it is disgraceful for academia. They pay assistant professors 35,000. 
2) The higher administration is always busy with fundraising and lobbying. They have little time to make actual advancement of academics. The president, provost and assistant provost in the college does not event have a PhD, when lot of faculties have a PhD. As the high command themselves did never went through higher education, they simply do not understand how to respect faculties. 
3) Most student here do not care about learning or education as much they do about athletics. 
4) Classrooms are poorly equipped with outdated technology 
5) There is almost no benefits that the college offers. Or may be they are so low that I did not even notice.

pros: Very nice small town. People are very friendly. Living cost is inexpensive.
cons: The college is poorly lead by the provost and the president, both had resigned and left colleges in June. Faculty and staff overturn rate is very high. To increase the enrollment numbers, the college accepted students that were completely  underprepared for college work. The campus wifi is much slower than residential wifi.
